main event: Aerial objects maneuvered at high speed, then dispersed at high speed in different directions over Kagoshima, Japan on September 24, 1955.
interesting points: The object was round, bright, and metallic in appearance., The observation lasted between 8 to 10 minutes., Radar contact was obtained with an unidentified target., The object moved silently at high speed, indicating advanced capabilities., The incident raised questions about air traffic and radar readings in the area.
witness description: crew members of an aircraft who felt there was an object present.
